metadata.name: Balancium #239
metadata.description:
"Balancium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at Art Basel, Basel 2022

In the fall of 1931, in Alexander Calder's studio, Marcel Duchamp coined the term 'mobile' for his kinetic sculptures. Later, Calder wrote: "This, in French, means not only 'movable'— but also a 'motive', 'a reason for an act' so I found it a very good word."
 
Around the same year, Bruno Munari started making colorful and whimsical mobiles. He called them "useless machines", existing without any purpose and inviting viewers to just look. Elements are connected with nearly invisible threads or wires, allowing the artist to create the illusion of shapes floating in the air.

Balancium is both a virtual mobile and a useless object. Generated by the code, it undergoes a continual transformation. The movement of the air, or invisible fluid, becomes an integral part of the design and amplifies serenity. 
 
There is a keyboard key that unlocks more variations.

metadata.name: A Bugged Forest #599
metadata.description:
A forest has stories to tell.
About times that were, about times that will be.
-
This project was minted in much unusual conditions. 
We gathered here, by 38 degrees heat. We belong to a crowd who loves stories, of civilisations at stake and deities, of afterlife and worship. We drank and hugged and chanted pagan hymns. We minted the Bugged Forest from our place on earth that we call Hell just for the fun of it. We are passionate, and loving, and angry and desperate. We, people of the soil, under a bugged sun.
-
This project is the long-form version of an algorithm that contains a bug. “The Bugged Tree”’s code was salvaged and stored and served as the core motivation and engine for an entire forest. Its concept is about releasing the control. I am a  byproduct of evolution, an iteration of that specie who wanted utter control, and which at some point, lost control over its own creation. As a generative artist, I chose to welcome the event of chance into my creative process. The symbolism in chance made me feel humble and free. Unwilling to make any change to a story that the Tree needed to tell me, as a listener, rather than a writer of my own idealised fantasies.
-
The iterations aren’t under control. They may be odd and off. We have to accept it. They are also plottable, press [s] in live mode to get a SVG. Attempt the plot at your own risk, as there’s a possibility for it to come near to impossibilities or cause paper or motor damage, and most certainly, a bugged drawing.
-
From Earth or from Hell, with love, yours truthfully, NFTBiker and zancan

metadata.name: Kintsugi #91
metadata.description:
Kintsugi is a philosophy, it's the concept of highlighting imperfections, visualizing patches and seams on the area to focus on, rather than focusing on missing details.

This art of precious scars is a technique used as a means of analyzing the idea of ​​loss through synthesis and restoration of the destroyed and a metaphor for the possibility of rebirth.
Recovery from destructive events is possible through care and patching, not through hiding the damage, but by accepting a new state of the object or the whole life.
The world is a vase that is endlessly disassembled and sewn together again, continuing to bear traces of each event.

Non-human entities helped us put these vases together. In the beginning, there were vague forms, these were the shards themselves, created in collaboration with Latent Diffusion. Over time, they have grown in detail, drawing their stories more clearly, thanks to Jax Diffusion.

The code that puts everything together was written by Yulikolay, for which he is greatly appreciated.

metadata.name: CR Art Sessions //1 #303
metadata.description:
In Argentina there is a very young and talented music producer called BIZARRAP.

He is very famous for the BZRP Music Sessions, which are tracks in collaboration with international artists that Bizarrap produces in his studio, which also serves as a recording studio for the official video clip of the track.

In these sessions the artists have the freedom to express themselves in ways that perhaps the industry doesn't allow them because they have an image to sell, or the freedom to deliver whatever they want.

For example, in the Music Session with Nicky Jam, the Puerto Rican artist sings rap in Spanish, English and reggaeton, all in the same song.

Inspired by this concept I decided to launch my CR Art Sessions format. The idea is to take previous works and reconvert them or give me the freedom to play with the algorithms and explore new options and parameters to reach their limits or to obtain something different but with the same essence.

The CR Art Sessions //1 is based on my first fx(hash) project called Geoetris. 

The same algorithm was slightly modified to produce 3 different types of art that the user will be able to visualize. 
1. The first type is an extreme version of the Geoetris project, where the parameters were modified to have blend between the pieces and generate many more elements on screen. 
2. The second is a composition of circles and squares, where there is a very simple rule that can only sometimes be broken and that is that the rectangles start in the middle of the circle. 
3. The third is a version where the larger geometric shapes are not filled and only their silhouette is marked.

-----

Reserves: All 'Geoetris' owners and 40-40 slots for 'Yo automata' and 'Isomeric Doppelgangers' owners

-----

Royalties: 50% to minter

-----

Controls:

Explore each art variant with the '1', '2', '3' keys

The 'e' key exports the current canvas

The 's' key exports the image in 3200x4000 px resolution

-----

Artwork by @cristianrohr (2022)

Made with P5js and <3.

metadata.name: SMOLSKULL-FLAG #92
metadata.description:
Smol flag to represent your place

Generative art by Mark Knol (@mknol)

metadata.name: Vissen #239
metadata.description:
Scribbled patterns. An exploration of colour and texture.

Press 's' to save an image.

If you want to increase the resolution of the saved image, add e.g. &size=2000 after the live/fullscreen view URL to render the canvas at that specific width (default = browser sized)

Add e.g. &ratio=1.2 to render at a different aspect ratio, like 1.2:1 (this will produce a visually different yet thematically similar output, default = 1.4)

metadata.name: HASH*W1NDOWS #43
metadata.description:
HASH*W1NDOWS made in PICO-8. 
Window tribute to John Karel by Y Griega.

Features:
51 Elements(6 rare).
32 Base Colours (4 layers)
12 Background Textures (3 layers).
4 Window views.

Rare Features:
+ Dark Palette (warm)
+ Death Palette (negative)
+  Fx (flys, glitch, etc...)
--twitter.com/YGriegaMX

metadata.name: visitor #165
metadata.description:
know yourself when the time comes

press 's' to save .png to device. artwork generates according to window size.

for smaller screens, to create a high resolution image: zoom out as much as possible, and hit refresh, to generate a high resolution image.
tested with chrome.

metadata.name: Smart Materials | E4071 #108
metadata.description:
The year is 2150. The phasing worlds resulting from the artificial singularity resulted in providing a gateway to alternate versions of Earth. Smart Materials is a glimpse of smart materials sourced from Earth 4071. Despite being a barren icy place, humanity has fared well, making use of the super low environmental temperatures specializing in cryo tech. Another fragment of a larger speculative series investigating the concepts of space and time in the era of post-human condition.

This piece consists of over a thousand different variations of the imagined smart material and its properties. Hover to play with it. Following are some notes from the first explorers to E4071.

'It looks like the insides of my lungs!'

'That's some creepy slimy shit. 
I don't want that thing around me inside my spaceship. 
What if it goes psycho killer on us?'

'Are we getting closer to the Trisolarian Civilization droplet tech? 
Probably just another gimmick!'
